channel.title: Dplyr on Ajinkya Shinde
channel.description: Recent content in Dplyr on Ajinkya Shinde

item.title: Take A Sad Plot And Make It Better 2.0 - Graph 3
item.description: 1. Relevant R Code moma <- read_csv(here("static", "data", "artworks-cleaned.csv")) f_moma<-moma %>% filter(artist_gender == "Female") f_moma2<-count(f_moma,year_created,artist_gender) ggplot(f_moma2,aes(x=year_created,y=n))+ geom_col(colour = "#414a4c",fill="#d26868")+ scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) + scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0))+ labs(x="Year paintings were created",y="Number of Paintings created", title="MoMA, Female paintings over the years")+ geom_smooth(model=lm,se=FALSE,color="#5e020c")+ theme_tufte(base_family = "Palatino Linotype") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) 2. Description of the TYPE of graph. The graph is a bar chart with the geom_smooth line showing the trend line.

item.title: Take A Sad Plot And Make It Better 2.0 - Graph 2
item.description: 1. Relevant R-Code cereal_untidy<-read.csv(file="../../static/data/cereal.csv") cereal_tidy<-cereal_untidy %>% gather(nutrition,nutr_stat,c("calories","protein","fat","sodium", "fiber","carbo","sugars","potass","vitamins")) %>% select(name,mfr,type,nutrition,nutr_stat) %>% filter(nutrition==c("calories","protein","fat","carbo")) ggplot(cereal_tidy)+geom_mosaic(aes(x=product(nutrition,mfr), fill=factor(nutrition))) + labs(x="Manufacturer", y ="Nutrition Breakdown") + guides(fill=guide_legend(title = "Nutrient", reverse = TRUE)) 2. Description of the TYPE of graph This type of graph is a Marimekko chart 3. Description of the DATA you used The data is gathered from Kaggle Dataset.It gives the nutrient information(such as calories,fat,protein etc.) for all the cereals across selected 7 brands.
